meanings.definition: To smear or daub with a sticky substance.
meanings.sent1: She was gauming the glue on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The child gaumed paint on the walls.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally gaumed the sauce on his apron.
meanings.sent4: The artist gaumed the colors together on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The student gaumed the glitter onto the project.

meanings.definition: To make a mess or cause confusion.
meanings.sent1: The siblings were gauming the room with their toys.
meanings.sent2: The spilled milk gaumed the tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick gaumed the audience's minds.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news gaumed the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The lost keys gaumed the morning routine.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally stepped in the gauming on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The tree sap was a thick gauming on the bark.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they played with the gauming.
meanings.sent4: The spilled syrup created a sweet gauming on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic wiped the greasy gauming off his hands.
